cp510.assignments.assignment9

Class ChessPoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • cp510.assignments.assignment9.ChessPoint

  • public class ChessPoint
extends java.lang.Object
    The ChessPoint class for the chess project. This is the row and column coordinates used to place,remove, check on the position of ChessPiece on the ChessPieceMap (a hashmap).
    Author:
    Toby Peterson.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChessPoint

        public ChessPoint()
        The default constructor for ChessPoint. It sets the row and col properties to (0, 0).

      • ChessPoint

        public ChessPoint(int row,
                  int col)
        The two parameter constructor for ChessPoint. It sets the row and column to the given values.
        Parameters:
        row - The given row.
        col - The given column.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public boolean add(int row,
                   int col)
        The add method for ChessPoint. It adds the given values to the row and column of this object.If the operation would cause either property to be less than 0 or greater than 7 the operation is not performed and false is returned.
        Parameters:
        row - The value to add to row.
        col - The value to add to col.
        Returns:
        True if the result of the operation is the location of a square on a chess board.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        The hashCode method for ChessPoint. It calculates a hash code for this ChessPoint. The algorithm produces a perfect hash in the range (0, 0) to (7, 7), inclusive. There should never be a collision between two points on a chess board. The algorithm is: 8 x row + col.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The calculated hashcode.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        The equals method for ChessPoint. It returns true if this ChessPoint is equal to the given object. The objects are equal if the given object is non-null, is an instance of ChessPoint and has the same row and column coordinates as this ChessPiece.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - The given object.
        Returns:
        True if the given object is equal to this ChessPoint, false if not.
